revised_title: Rapidly Rotating Relativistic Stars: Equilibrium, Stability, and Oscillations
tldr: This article discusses the structure, stability, and oscillations of rapidly rotating relativistic stars, focusing on the equations governing perfect fluids and the construction of stellar models. The authors explore the limitations on mass and rotation, as well as the oscillation and stability of these stars, including the role of viscosity and the non-axisymmetric instability that can restrict the maximum rotation. The research has implications for understanding pulsars and compact astrophysical sources like neutron stars.
